meanings.definition: The quality or state of being regenerated.
meanings.sent1: The regeneracy of the forest after the fire was truly remarkable.
meanings.sent2: The regeneracy of the soil was evident after the heavy rainfall.
meanings.sent3: The regeneracy of the old car made it look brand new.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness had a regeneracy that touched everyone around her.
meanings.sent5: The regeneracy of the garden brought vibrant colors back to life.

meanings.sent1: The regeneracy of the skin cells is essential for healing.
meanings.sent2: The regeneracy of the ecosystem is crucial for its sustainability.
meanings.sent3: The regeneracy of the computer system fixed all the bugs.
meanings.sent4: The regeneracy of the town's economy brought new opportunities.
meanings.sent5: The regeneracy of the riverbanks prevented erosion and flooding.

meanings.sent1: The regeneracy of the city brought back its former glory.
meanings.sent2: The regeneracy of the team spirit led to their victory.
meanings.sent3: The regeneracy of the painting made it look like a masterpiece again.
meanings.sent4: The regeneracy of the music industry breathed new life into old genres.
meanings.sent5: The regeneracy of the community center revitalized the neighborhood.
